## Command and MP/LEOs are held to a higher standard.
These rules also apply to any individual who is promoted or is acting in the place of a MP/Command role (unless they are a member of a hostile force).\n[italic]Command roles are defined as; all heads, cic staff, mp, and squad/platoon leaders.[/italic]
## General Rules - [bold]Command must make an attempt to follow the UCMJ[/bold], except if they are correctly part of a valid mutiny. - Do not willingly and openly cooperate with hostile forces.\nSome leeway is given to making deals with hostile forces if the deal benefits the safety or situation of your faction or personnel as a whole and not just yourself. - Do not abandon your position to do things unrelated to your role. - Do not immediately abandon your installation or ship during a raid. Protect the location and it's crew, don't let hostile forces kill everyone without a fight, and ensure they evacuate safely if needed.
- You are expected to be able to communicate clearly and concisely when communicating on radio channels and announcements, and while in any professional setting.
## Command specific - Command are at minimum expected to report criminal activity.
## MP Specific - MPs and Law Enforcement are expected to intervene into criminal activity where possible, unless it conflicts with marine law. - The MP are not combat roles, and should focus solely on enforcing laws when planetside, if granted permission to do so.
